storyInfo: In 1068, a Leithanian Kurfürst locates the nomadic city of Kazdel. The Sarkaz rally under the Military Commission to defend their home against the impending crisis.

attributes.content: Wasserland, Leithanien
How do you like this piece?
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Like an energetic child waking from slumber, rushing out the door to enjoy the fruits of life to the fullest.
attributes.name: Lateran Cleric

attributes.content: It was the Kurfürst who wrote it, inspired by His Holiness's visit to Wasserland when he was still a Messenger for Laterano.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: The young and enthusiastic future pontiff told the children about all that he has seen... the ocean that Iberia watches over, the city of Athenius, where Minoan myth and machination exist in equal measure.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: And... a passing mention of Kazdel, the city of sin, the whereabouts of which are unknown.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: The Kurfürst was there, and he was fascinated by His Holiness's descriptions.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: The first draft of this work was in fact written at that time, but the Kurfürst was not satisfied. Even after many years of revisions, a final draft has yet to be completed...
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Until recently, when our scouts located the elusive nomadic city of the devils and sent back photos.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Gazing upon the enormous tracks left behind by the city, the Kurfürst found the missing element in the music—ferocity. With that, the work was complete.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: You found Kazdel?
attributes.name: Lateran Cleric

attributes.content: Yes. The Kurfürst was astonished to find that the destiny of the work was intertwined with the city's.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: I understand the reason the Kurfürst chose to present this piece on the eve of my return to Laterano.
attributes.name: Lateran Cleric

attributes.content: However, unlike his predecessors, His Holiness has no intention of initiating offensive action against the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Lateran Cleric

attributes.content: He is not interested in putting the sinless on trial without cause. I'm afraid I must disappoint the Kurfürst.
attributes.name: Lateran Cleric

attributes.content: The city itself is of no concern to the Kurfürst. He is far more interested in His Holiness's opinion of the piece.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Please send His Holiness the Kurfürst's warmest regards.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: We have a response from Siracusa. Only a few of the famiglie have agreed to participate in the action. Their men will rendezvous with the fleet soon.
attributes.name: Courier

attributes.content: I can't believe Laterano rejected us... Inform the Siracusans to move quickly. We must mop up the city before the other kreise can react.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Take Kazdel before the other Kurfürsten can. Do not repeat the mistake we made at Gaul and miss another opportunity.
attributes.name: Amiable Official

attributes.content: Scar Market, Kazdel
I like Leithanians. You always bring so much business.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: And it's smart that you disguised yourself as a prisoner in a smuggling crew, rather than flying the banner of a Messenger.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Now tell me what you want, before I lose my patience.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Trade, muscle for hire, intel... The Scar Market has everything you need.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Cooperation, esteemed leader.
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: We don't have a fixed price for 'cooperation'.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Are you sure your Kurfürst can pay my price?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Don’t you want to know what we're asking for first?
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: There's nothing that money cannot buy here, Caprinae.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What about Kazdel?
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: ...Go on.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The Kurfürst wants you to sabotage the city's propulsion system, nothing else.
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: The down-payment is in the safe that you took from the caravan.
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: The Kurfürst will discuss the rest of the payment with you in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Nervous Envoy

attributes.content: I admire your boldness. Let me express my good faith with a little glimpse into the future for you.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
Take your things and scram, Leithanian! Are you trying to poison me?
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: These are just suppressants. You'll need them on the battlefield...
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: The warships that surround us came from Leithanien!
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: Outsiders like you must have led them here!
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: I... I don't have an explanation. I know you're taking your son with you into battle. He could use the medicine—
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: Keep your hands off my son!
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: What's the commotion—are you out of your mind? She's a Babel doctor!
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Are you okay?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: I'm fine. He wasn't really trying to hurt me.
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: Hmph. Goodluck.
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: You married a Babel woman, and now you've become a shill for the invaders? They'll be the death of you, I guarantee it.
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: Many of us are also pained by the impending war...
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: We've requested to join you on the frontlines.
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: Lunatics... who knows what schemes you have on the frontline... you'll get yours in the end...
attributes.name: Angry Sarkaz

attributes.content: Give me the medicine. I'll distribute it.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: They're ready to leave. Go meet up with them. I'll take care of things here.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Goodluck, your son...
attributes.name: Dejected Babel Member

attributes.content: I didn't let him leave.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: If the Leithanians want to force us into a Catastrophe, it's safer for him to be in the lower-level shelters in the city.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Relax, doctor. People have made it through Catastrophes in the past. Maybe we'll have, you know, good luck!
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: The furnace has burned for more than a century.
War, Catastrophe, migration, exile... all the suffering since the Teekaz era has not extinguished the hatred of the revenants.
The Sarkaz have seen many Kazdels through the ages. The memory of yesterday may be unrecognizable by tomorrow...
But the Soul Furnace has been a constant for this generation of Sarkaz.
Home is where the Soul Furnace is.
Kazdel.
The furnace has not burned like this for many years. I can hear the cries of the revenants even from here.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Soon, this city will charge headlong into a Catastrophe...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: All we need to do is hold out until Nezzsalem's reinforcements arrive, until Kazdel once again passes through the Catastrophe—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They thought we would cower. They tried to assume our thoughts with their conception of common sense. It was so a hundred and seventy years ago, and it is so now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Arrogant and laughable fools who never took the time to truly understand us.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: What fate do you think awaits this city, Theresis?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: To be honest, the chances that it survives are slim.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Kazdel was immobilized the last time it braved a Catastrophe. It took us a decade just to get it moving at full speed again.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And the forests of crystals in the mines and on the walls could never be removed, ruining years of our plans for the city.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I don't know if the city can survive another ordeal like that, much less one that's even worse. Good luck rarely comes twice.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I believe in this city, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Not because of luck, but because we built this city, and I won't give up on it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The story of this city does not end here, Your Highness.
I may not be able to see its future clearly, but there is one thing I can say for sure—the city continues to exist into the distant future.
No one can say, however, if it will be a sanctuary of hope, or a ghost city of the dead.
Scareye... have you not grown tired of the ambiguous words of your kind?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And need I remind you that no amount of mercenaries can ensure your safety in this city.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: There is no deceiving Your Highnesses, of course.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Kazdel's doors are open to every Sarkaz, but you'd better have a good reason to set foot in this city with your mercenaries at a time like this.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I was made an offer most difficult to refuse, which obliged me to enter the city to seek an audience.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What is that you're carrying?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This? Something insignificant. Oh, I mean someone. The Leithanians wanted me to sabotage Kazdel.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I have been away from my kin for many years, but as your Highness said, Kazdel is the root of all Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: So, I felt that I had to deliver this Leithanian with my own hands, in order to prove my innocence.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What are you thinking?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Exactly as I have said. What can I possibly hide before the King of Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: But if you're not interested in my gift of good faith, then I see no need to carry it with me anymore. It's heavy, after all.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: He casually casts the bag into the furnace, where it is incinerated in an instant.
Without a sound.
The furnace is always an impressive sight, no matter how many times one sees it.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Your Highness need not pity him. He should have foreseen the risks when he approached the Scar Market.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I trust Leithanien was not miserly with its terms.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It's simple, Your Highness. I prefer immediate payment over empty promises. But more importantly, I don't work with the losing side.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Are you predicting our victory?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It wasn't I who saw it. It was the Cyclops who left the prophecy a thousand years ago. I'm simply betting that Your Highnesses are the protagonists of the prophecy.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Regardless, the safest business for the Scar Market is with Your Highnesses. It would keep business flowing for at least the next fifty years or so.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Is that not so, Your Highnesses?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're clever. Prophecy doesn't bring victory, but we can. Bring your mercenaries. We're moving out.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The crowd stirs.
The Sarkaz procession leaving the city is quiet, except for the occasional clang of weapons and equipment.
Their silence is rooted in the knowledge of the fate that awaited them beyond the city’s gates.
They wrap banners, torn from the walls, around their waists, or clutch Originium spikes, chopped from the streets, as makeshift weapons...
Each has their own ritual to remember the city that they may never return to.
Mom... Dad, where are you?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Dad! Mom!
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Hmph... people really need to watch their kids. They can’t be allowed to run wild.
attributes.name: Indifferent Woman

attributes.content: Ouch...
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Careful.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Th-Thank you.
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Where did you come from? Why are you also leaving the city? You'll fall if you’re not careful.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: I'm looking for my mom and dad. Are you going out, too?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Yes... I'm going to the battlefield.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Are you looking for your mom and dad there, too? Can I come with you?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: No... I'm by myself.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Why are you going out, then?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Because I don't want to hide in the city. I want to fight the people who are doing bad things to us. That's what my parents told me before they... they left.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: I... I want to fight, too, but Mom and Dad won't let me go. I tried to sneak out and got a beating when they found out. But I don't want to be away from Mom and Dad.
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: We'll go together then, and find your mom and dad. But there'll be a lot of bad people out there. Are you scared?
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: You're not scared. Mom and Dad aren't scared. I'm not scared either!
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: The disheveled child pumps his fists to show courage, but his trembling betrays him.
The older child knows that the young boy does not fully understand what is happening outside the city.
But the young boy knows something simple but true.
Bad guys should be chased away. Families should stay together. So he takes the boy's hand, and joins the procession.
How do we find your parents when we're out there?
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: They work for Babel. They have a picture of a tower on their clothes.
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Babel. I know that place.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Are you from Babel too?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: No, I grew up in a Military Commission institution. I guess I'm from the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Military Commission? What's that?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: A place that protects people, just like Babel.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: What's your dad's name? Let's squeeze our way to the front. Maybe they're up ahead.
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Goodluck!
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Good luck?
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Yes, he's Goodluck... why are you laughing?
attributes.name: Lost Child

attributes.content: Nothing... let's shout his name. Maybe he'll hear you!
attributes.name: Brave Child

attributes.content: Two children squeeze forward in the procession, holding each other's hand, calling out 'Goodluck' with their tiny voices.
A few heads turn, and sigh when they see the young and naive faces.
Good luck.
It is what they all need.
On an evening in the autumn of 1068, the music playing in the Kurfürst of Wasserland's study was interrupted by the sound of frantic knocking on the door.
The fleet that was pursuing the nomadic city of Kazdel had broken off its pursuit.
'Those crazy devils charged straight into a Catastrophe. It's only by sheer good luck that they got away.'
Years later, the Kurfürst of Wasserland still recounted the reason for his failure with palpable disdain.
